intro: Vincetoxicum anatolicum, commonly known as Anatolian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its roots contain various alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats across its native range.
